intro: Philyra brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian philyra, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, fibrous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
